Wade Deadpool.Action: Asks for help getting through the car, accepts assistance from the cabbie, and engages in friendly handshake and banter.
Adjusts weapons and attempts to maneuver in a confined space but struggles and requires help from the cabbie.
Maintains composure and humor despite awkward physical predicament, showing social confidence.
Shares heartfelt advice about love with Dopinder, showing empathy and sincerity.
Eats Dopinder's open bag of Corn Nuts without asking.
Armed to the teeth with twin katanas and twin .50 caliber pistols, showing preparedness and combat readiness.
Grabs Dopinder's open bag of Corn Nuts without permission, showing casual disregard for social norms but not necessarily incompetence.
Turns up his mask to reveal a scarred face, indicating confidence and lack of self-consciousness.
Engages in a meaningful conversation about love and gives advice to Dopinder, showing emotional intelligence and insight.
Expresses palpable heartbreak and takes a deep, cleansing breath, showing emotional self-awareness but also vulnerability.
Encourages holding onto love and fighting for it, despite using crude humor.
Uses crude and off-putting humor to describe unpleasant things.
Shows frustration and mild panic when he can't find his extra magazines.
Does not react negatively or rudely when a blind elderly woman trips over his ammunition bag and carries it off.
Refuses to turn back despite potential danger or inconvenience, showing determination.
Chucks bag of Corn Nuts, pulls out pistols, chambers shells into magazines confidently.
Frantically pats himself down looking for extra magazines, realizes they are missing.
Decides not to turn back despite missing extra magazines, loads last bullets and prepares to fight.
Slaps hands with Dopinder and says 'I owe you one. Merry Christmas, Dopinder.'
Refuses to carry a wallet while working to maintain the lines of his suit, showing attention to detail and practical thinking.
Engages in casual banter and a high five with Dopinder before exiting the cab with a flourish, demonstrating social confidence and situational awareness.
Sits dangling legs over the edge of a high freeway overpass, displaying a casual, possibly reckless attitude that could indicate overconfidence or lack of caution.
Draws a childish, violent picture of himself shooting a man in the head and looks pleased by it.
Addresses the camera with sarcastic, irreverent humor and self-aware commentary about his movie and persona.
Uses broken crayons to draw a childish, violent picture and makes immature jokes to the camera.
Speaks directly to the camera with confident, humorous commentary about his movie and upcoming actions.
Casually gets up and pirouettes to drop an entire level down, preparing to engage the convoy.
Raises his arms in greeting while attacking, uses humor and playful language despite violent situation.
Engages in brutal violence, including breaking a man's neck and smashing faces into car parts.
Stuns multiple enemies with elbows and uses combat skills to incapacitate them quickly.
Rolls with a brutal punch and uses feet to break an opponent's neck, showing adaptability and lethal skill.
Gets his face smashed into the seat's premium trim repeatedly but continues to fight back.
Uses the passenger seatbelt to tie an enemy's ankle and kicks him out of the vehicle, demonstrating quick thinking and resourcefulness.
Makes humorous and distracting remarks during combat (e.g., 'Rich... Corinthian... Leather.'), which may indicate confidence but could also risk focus.
Violently assaults multiple men with no apparent mercy or hesitation, including dragging a man by the ankle and burning a man's forehead with a cigarette lighter.
Ties the passenger's ankle to the seatbelt and kicks him out the door, effectively neutralizing him.
Uses the environment (car horn, stereo) to repeatedly bash the driver's forehead, disorienting him.
Observes the man in the back crawling up the tailgate and reacts by pushing in the cigarette lighter and yanking the emergency brake to disrupt him.
Burns the man in the back with the cigarette lighter and silences him by stuffing the lighter in his mouth and clamping his hand.
Uses violent and reckless tactics to neutralize enemies, showing disregard for their well-being.
Breaks the fourth wall with a humorous, self-aware comment during a violent scene.
Known for immaturity and criminality, refuses to join X-Men despite chances given.
Known for immaturity and criminality, fails to join the X-Men despite opportunities.
Is recognized by others (Colossus) as a potential X-Man, implying some underlying capability.
Jokes about his red suit and bleeding to lighten the mood before a shootout.
Engages in violent shootout immediately after joking, showing disregard for peaceful resolution.
Keeps count of every bullet he fires during a violent shootout.
Shoots a thug in the back of the head at point blank range without hesitation.
Keeps precise count of every bullet fired during a firefight, demonstrating focus and control.
Leaps and flips to avoid incoming fire, showing agility and tactical awareness.
Shoots a thug in the back of the head at point-blank range while sneaking around the car, indicating stealth and decisiveness.
Fails to find his target inside the Escalade, suggesting a momentary lapse or incomplete information.
Shoots a thug multiple times out of anger after he is out of bullets, including superfluous shots.
Shoots a grenade out of a thug's hand to protect himself and others.
Dives behind cover, assesses situation by searching the SUV interior, and continues to engage despite being shot.
Uses torn suit fabric to staunch bleeding from a gunshot wound.
Closes distance to enemy under heavy fire, showing tactical aggression.
Shoots the thug after he runs out of bullets, demonstrating marksmanship and timing.
Fires two extra bullets into a downed enemy out of anger, an unnecessary action.
Shoots a grenade out of a thug's hand, preventing an explosion and neutralizing multiple enemies.
Gets childishly angry when the prisoner is not found.
Engages in violent shootout with thugs without hesitation.
Uses humor ('I'm touching myself tonight') in a tense combat situation.
Leaps from cover, twists mid-air to avoid shotgun fire, and shoots three enemies in a single bullet sequence, demonstrating precise marksmanship and agility.
Expresses childish anger upon not finding his target immediately.
Admits to insecurity about his physique in a self-deprecating way.
Kills thug with katana blades without hesitation.

Makes a humorous internal commentary about working out and insecurity while in mid-action.

Engages Jeremy in casual banter about pizza preferences and fist bumps him before revealing his true intent.
Nonchalantly pulls out a .50 caliber Desert Eagle pistol and confidently takes control of the situation without hesitation.
Engages in casual banter while maintaining focus on his objective, showing skill in multitasking under pressure.
Takes the entire wallet instead of just the money, indicating a strategic approach to leverage resources.

Pistol-punches Merchant but follows with teasing comments about his jeans and body spray.

Pins Jeremy against the wall with a knife, clearly intimidating him and controlling the situation without losing composure.

Responds seriously to a girl's request for help against authority figures, showing concern and willingness to listen.
